name: Ultimate Ham Cups
author: Patty Ruth Hand Pirko
summary: I created this recipe to use leftovers from Thanksgiving for a day-after brunch. It combines the best of the holiday flavors - smoked ham, cranberries, almonds, and smoked mozzarella cheese - into puff pastry shells, to make a really elegant presentation for a buffet, or it could be put into mini muffin pans for an appetizer. Sprinkle with finely chopped parsley or paprika if desired.
ingredients: 1 sheet frozen puff pastry dough, thawed
1 teaspoon melted butter, or as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Melt 1/4 cup butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Whisk in flour until fully incorporated
Add milk; bring to a slow boil
Add nutmeg, white pepper, cayenne, and salt
Remove from heat and let filling cool slightly
Add ham, mozzarella cheese, cranberries, and almonds
Roll out puff pastry on a lightly floured work surface
Stretch gently to enlarge and place squares, buttered side-down, into muffin cups
Divide filling evenly between the cups
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes
